subject: RE: [junit] Testing certain types of methods
msgSnippet: It limits you from sticking with your poor design. ________________________________ From: Soaring Eagle [mailto:comfortable.numb@gmail.com] Sent: Monday,
messageBody:
It limits you from sticking with your poor design.



________________________________

From: Soaring Eagle [mailto:comfortable.numb@...]
Sent: Monday, February 14, 2005 1:57 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Testing certain types of methods


how can this be a limitation?


On Mon, 14 Feb 2005 15:37:04 -0500, J. B. Rainsberger
<jbrains@...> wrote:
> Vamsee Kanakala wrote:
>
> > Absolutely! And I'm amazed at how many design mistakes I
find while
> > unit-testing. You're trying to test something, it feels
unintuitive, and
> > ka-boom! You know what's wrong. JUnit rocks!
>
> For every one of you, there are a hundred others who see this
as a
> limitation of JUnit. Shame.
> --
> J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
> Diaspar Software Services
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com
> Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer
Testing
